title: Stellar puts part of DigiCore proceeds to use in Torre acquisition | Telecoms & Technology
text:
Picture: THINKSTOCK Related articles Novatel buyout offer boosts DigiCore shares Novatel offer lifts DigiCore Stellar Capital buys stake in Torre DigiCore shares rev up on buyout offer report In this article JSE-listed companies: DigiCore STELLAR Capital Partners plans to use some of the millions it will make from selling its shares in DigiCore to buy shares in Torre Industries, a deal it announced earlier this year.
Shareholders in the investment holding company on Wednesday approved the disposal of its 19.26% holding in the vehicle tracking and fleet management company. This will net Stellar R209.8m in cash once a takeover deal from Novatel Wireless proceeds next month.
Stellar finance chief Charl de Villiers said R130.2m of the proceeds would be used to settle the cash portion of its R909.3m cash and share offer for 34.58% of industrial group Torre.
"The remainder will be retained as cash resources on our balance sheet," he said.
DigiCore is the sole distributor of some of the Nasdaq-listed Novatel’s products in SA.
Novatel has agreed to buy the local company for $87m. DigiCore shareholders approved the transaction and the delisting of its shares from the JSE on Wednesday.
The DigiCore sale marks Stellar’s exit from another information and communications technology (ICT) venture. Stellar, which was formerly called ConvergeNet, sold electronics engineering company Contract Kitting and ICT company SCS to electronics company Tellumat late last year in exchange for 30% of Tellumat’s shares.
"We view Tellumat as a platform for the growth of our investment in the ICT sector and will be looking to increase our exposure here rather than to exit," said Mr De Villiers. "We are building a portfolio of industrial, financial and ICT assets, although we will retain the capacity to consider other sectors on an opportunistic basis.
"We are a long-term strategic investor and will only invest where we believe we can add value."
